articles.title: Apple is first tech company accused of violating EU's new competition law
articles.summary: The European Union has accused Apple of violating its new Digital Markets Act, making Apple the first tech company to face charges under the law. The investigation focuses on Apple's app store rules, which allegedly hinder developers from directing consumers to alternative purchasing methods. Apple has a chance to respond before a final decision in March 2025, potentially facing fines up to 20% of its global revenue for repeated infringements.

articles.title: Apple may start iPad production in India, AirPod charging cases at Jabil facility in Pune, says report
articles.summary: Apple is reportedly considering starting iPad production in India under the country's PLI scheme, after issues with previous plans in China. The tech giant also aims to increase the local production of parts for AirPod wireless charging cases and potentially laptops and desktops, partnering with Jabil Inc. or Foxconn. India is increasingly becoming a significant manufacturing hub for Apple, with plans to produce a quarter of all iPhones in the country within the next few years.

articles.title: A Shakeup for Technology ETFs
articles.summary: The Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) recently underwent a significant rebalance, swapping a large position in Apple for Nvidia. This rebalance highlights the complexities of index rules, particularly the RIC diversification test, and its impact on ETF holdings. The article discusses how passive indexing can sometimes appear active due to various exceptions and weighting methodologies, influencing ETF performance and investor perceptions.

articles.title: What Exactly Does NVIDIA Do, and Why Should You Care?
articles.summary: This article provides an introduction to NVIDIA, highlighting its transformation from a GPU manufacturer to a systems company offering hardware and an ecosystem for developers. It delves into the factors driving NVIDIA's success, its significant impact on the customer experience market through AI, and key partnerships with companies like Cisco, SAP, and ServiceNow. The piece emphasizes NVIDIA's role in advancing AI for personalized and intelligent customer interactions across various sectors.

articles.title: Active investing is suited to the uncertain markets ahead
articles.summary: The article argues that changing market conditions, characterized by higher rates, greater dispersion, and heightened volatility, will favor active investing over passive strategies. While passive investing saw significant growth in recent decades, primarily due to low interest rates and index concentration, narrowing fee gaps and the rise of active ETFs suggest a shift in the investment landscape. Active managers with strong research capabilities are expected to thrive by identifying opportunities in a more discerning market.

articles.title: Why Blue Chips Are Ripe for Growth Investing
articles.summary: The article discusses why blue-chip companies are attractive for growth investing, particularly through the Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG). Sonu Kalra, FBCG's portfolio manager, highlights the compelling time for growth stocks due to an innovation cycle, emphasizing that many large companies are also highly innovative. He details FBCG's strategy of investing in companies with sustainable business models, strong earnings growth, and competitive advantages, focusing on themes like artificial intelligence and health and wellness.

articles.title: Corning raises second-quarter core sales forecast driven by AI boom
articles.summary: Corning raised its second-quarter core sales forecast to about $3.6 billion, up from an earlier estimate of $3.4 billion, due to surging demand for its fiber optic products driven by the adoption of generative AI technology. The company's fiber optic solutions are crucial for hyperscale data centers that require high-capacity cables to transmit large amounts of data for AI systems. Corning's shares rose more than 9% following the announcement.

articles.title: The Case for Investing in a Capital Appreciation ETF
articles.summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation ETF (TCAF) has shown rapid growth since its launch in June 2023, accumulating $1.7 billion in assets. This active ETF focuses on U.S. large-cap equities with a bottom-up stock selection approach, seeking attractive valuations and strong management. Managed by award-winning portfolio manager David Giroux, TCAF aims to capitalize on market opportunities through fundamental analysis and may be particularly advantageous in a period of anticipated interest rate divergence.

articles.title: Affirm Card Users' Data Compromised in Evolve Bank Cybersecurity Breach: Report
articles.summary: Affirm Holdings Inc. announced that personal information of its card users was compromised due to a cybersecurity incident at Evolve Bank and Trust, a third-party issuer of Affirm cards. While Evolve Bank confirmed the breach and is investigating with law enforcement, Affirm's own systems remained uncompromised, allowing cardholders to continue using their cards. Affirm has also launched its independent investigation into the incident.

articles.title: What’s the Secret Sauce in this High-Income Fund?
articles.summary: The article explores the success of Fidelity Tactical High Income Sr F, managed by Adam Kramer, highlighting its consistent category-beating performance. Kramer attributes the fund's "secret sauce" to a flexible mandate across various income-oriented asset classes, the ability to preserve capital in down markets, and skillful matching of bonds and stocks. The fund's strategy involves actively adjusting asset class weightings and leveraging expertise from a specialized team to identify the best risk-reward opportunities across the capital structure.

articles.title: Collective Audience CEO, Peter Bordes, Appointed to Symitri’s All-Star Board of Digital Tech Executives and Investors
articles.summary: Collective Audience, Inc. CEO Peter Bordes has been appointed to the board of directors of Symitri, a new company focused on integrated privacy firewalls and real-time data cleanrooms for the open web. Bordes brings over 30 years of experience in AdTech, media, AI, fintech, and technology, having founded and led numerous companies. Symitri aims to balance the economic viability of open-web advertising with consumer privacy, and Bordes joins other tech executives like Keith Bank and Jeff White to advance this mission.

articles.title: SPYG: S&P 500 Growth Stocks Are Pricey, But Still Worth It (NYSEARCA:SPYG)
articles.summary: The SPDR S&P 500 Growth ETF (SPYG) tracks the S&P 500 Growth Index, focusing on stocks with strong sales and earnings growth, price momentum, and high valuations. Despite historical underperformance compared to some peers due to its price momentum screen, the author anticipates continued outperformance for SPYG, assigning it a "buy" rating. This outlook is based on competitive growth rates, slightly below-average valuations, and strong Wall Street sentiment, especially after the upcoming rebalancing.

articles.title: Collective Audience CEO, Peter Bordes, Appointed to Symitri’s All-Star Board of Digital Tech Executives and Investors
articles.summary: Peter Bordes, CEO of Collective Audience, Inc. (NASDAQ-GM:CAUD), has been appointed to the board of directors of Symitri, a company pioneering integrated privacy firewall and real-time data cleanroom technology for the open web. Bordes, a seasoned entrepreneur and investor with over 30 years of experience, joins other tech executives and investors, Keith Bank and Jeff White, to guide Symitri's mission of balancing open internet advertising with consumer privacy. Symitri's solution enables deterministic identity connections for media buyers and sellers without exposing personal data, aiming to provide a sustainable model for the ad-supported internet.

articles.title: Skydance, Paramount Global Agree on Deal; David Ellison, Jeff Shell to Lead ‘New Paramount’
articles.summary: Skydance Media and Paramount Global have announced an $8 billion merger agreement that will result in Skydance acquiring Paramount Global. David Ellison of Skydance will become CEO and chairman of the newly formed "New Paramount," with former NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell serving as president. The deal involves Skydance and its investor group acquiring National Amusements Inc. for $2.4 billion and injecting an additional $6 billion into Paramount Global, subject to regulatory approval.

articles.title: Fumble! Your Favorite NFL Team Is On The Hook For $450 Million In Sunday Ticket Lawsuit, 1.76x More Than Player Pay In 2024
articles.summary: A federal jury has ruled that the NFL must pay between $4.7 billion and $14.4 billion in damages due to a class-action lawsuit over anticompetitive practices related to the Sunday Ticket television package. If the maximum amount is upheld, each of the 32 NFL teams would be liable for approximately $450 million, an amount significantly higher than their 2024 player salaries. The NFL plans to appeal the verdict.
